segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami … pe …
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …

segments.pli: ekamantaṃ nisinno so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
“kathaṃ nu kho, bhante, jānato kathaṃ passato micchādiṭṭhi pahīyatī”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, how does one know and see so that wrong view is given up?”

segments.pli: “Cakkhuṃ kho, bhikkhu, aniccato jānato passato micchādiṭṭhi pahīyati.
segments.en: “Mendicant, knowing and seeing the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact as impermanent, wrong view is given up. …

segments.pli: Rūpe aniccato jānato passato micchādiṭṭhi pahīyati.
Cakkhuviññāṇaṃ aniccato jānato passato micchādiṭṭhi pahīyati.
Cakkhusamphassaṃ aniccato jānato passato micchādiṭṭhi pahīyati … pe …
yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccato jānato passato micchādiṭṭhi pahīyati.
segments.en: And also knowing and seeing the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact as impermanent, wrong view is given up.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, jānato evaṃ passato micchādiṭṭhi pahīyatī”ti.
segments.en: This is how to know and see so that wrong view is given up.”

sections.title: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha ……

suttaplex.blurb: Wrong view arises due to grasping the process of sense experience.
